definitions.definition: a building fitted with equipment for grinding grain into flour; a machine for grinding grain

examples.text: The old mill has been converted into apartments.
The mill can be seen grinding wheat.
The river was harnessed to drive many mills.

definitions.definition: a factory that produces a particular type of material
a small machine for grinding a solid substance into powder
to have or make somebody have a difficult time

examples.text: They really put me through the mill in my interview.

definitions.definition: something that is useful to somebody for a particular purpose

examples.text: Political sex scandals are all grist to the mill of the tabloid newspapers.

wordOrigin: Old English mylen, based on late Latin molinum, from Latin mola ‘grindstone, mill’, from molere ‘to grind’.
